questions.label: ICEBREAKER
prompts: What is the best TV show/movie that you watched recently?
What are some misconceptions that people have about engineers?
What other languages do you speak? Teach everyone to say “hello” in that language.
UC Socially Dead; Agree or disagree?
If you had to become a teacher, what subject would you teach?
Who is your favorite singer/band?
If you were to become a YouTuber, what would your topic be (e.g., vlogger, gamer, etc.)?
What has been your favorite Engineering class so far?
What is something that you are looking forward to?
Are you planning to go into industry or academia? Why?
If you could visit any place in the world, where would it be and why?
What is your favorite programming language? Why?
Star Wars or Harry Potter?
If you could become a professional athlete, what sport would you play?
What makes you feel old when you think about it?

questions.label: IDEATION
prompts: Give an elevator pitch of your project idea (30 seconds or less).
What is the coolest thing you have built using raspberry pi, or any other hardware?
What kind of on-body sensors could we design for a smart watch?
Give an elevator pitch of your project idea (30 seconds or less).

questions.label: TEAM QUESTION
prompts: What do you believe is the most important factor for a successful team?
How is your course load this quarter?
What is your biggest pet peeve in group projects?
Based on previous team projects, what do you think worked and didn't work for you?
What do you hope to get out of this class?
Describe your management experience (e.g., student club president or project leader)?
What do you look for in a good team member?
Ideally, how often would you like to meet with your team members?
How do you deal with conflicts in a team?
What are your strengths and weaknesses in group projects?
What is your main mode of communication for your project (e.g., email, Facebook, etc.)?
How do you decide to split the work among team members?
How is your course load this quarter?
What is your biggest pet peeve in group projects?
Ideally, how often would you like to meet with your team members?
